page.title: 14The Coal Posts.
page.content: In Colney Heath there are four{coal {posts. }The {coal posts were there to {mark the boundary of London.}If they wanted to take coal into{London to pay {a coal tax.}The front of the Queens Head is where they paid their coaltax. It was called a toll house.The coal posts are{white.They are the {shape of a tower with a base on the {bottom.}On one of them there is written 24 and 25 Vict cap 42. 24 and 25 mean the 24th and 25th year of Queen Victoria's reign. 42 means 42nd chapter of an Act of Parliament. The coal post also has the coat of arms of the city of London on it.
